text:
I was still running the devnet on 0.4.0. I was able to update to 0.4.1, but if I try to update to 0.4.2 or 0.4.3, container creation is stuck in waiting:

```[+] Running 5/7
 ✔ Network splice-validator_splice_validator     Created                                                                                                                                                                                        0.0s
 ✔ Container splice-validator-postgres-splice-1  Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                        6.6s
 ✔ Container splice-validator-wallet-web-ui-1    Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                       30.6s
 ✔ Container splice-validator-ans-web-ui-1       Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                       30.6s
 ⠹ Container splice-validator-participant-1      Waiting                                                                                                                                                                                      355.9s
 ⠹ Container splice-validator-validator-1        Waiting                                                                                                                                                                                      355.9s
 ✔ Container splice-validator-nginx-1            Healthy                                                                                                                                                                                       11.5s```
Any advice?

text: Is there an issue to discuss this feature ? Today there is only one scope AFAIK : `daml_ledger_api`, It will very usefull to have different scope like: `daml_ledger_api_reader, daml_ledger_api_external_signing, daml_ledger_api_user_management, daml_ledger_api_transfer`etc... For UI users but also to be able to secure access and have granularity for application m2m access , external signing provider etc ...

elements.text: Is there an issue to discuss this feature ? Today there is only one scope AFAIK :
daml_ledger_api
, It will very usefull to have different scope like:
daml_ledger_api_reader, daml_ledger_api_external_signing, daml_ledger_api_user_management, daml_ledger_api_transfer

text: Maybe this is not an issue but a feature request? For <https://docs.dev.sync.global/app_dev/validator_api/index.html#validator-api>, if we have a data team, we want to give them read-only access to the API (get balances, transactions) but not other admin APIs. Similarly, if we want to add an external signing provider on our validator (like BYOV solution <https://www.dfns.co/article/canton-byov-support>), we want to give access to external signing API and user management. Could the <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/main/apps/common/src/main/scala/org/lfdecentralizedtrust/splice/auth/AuthExtractor.scala#L39|JwtClaims> be enhanced to support those functionalities?

elements.text: Maybe this is not an issue but a feature request? For

, if we have a data team, we want to give them read-only access to the API (get balances, transactions) but not other admin APIs. Similarly, if we want to add an external signing provider on our validator (like BYOV solution
), we want to give access to external signing API and user management. Could the
JwtClaims
be enhanced to support those functionalities?

Hi Curtis,
Thanks for your message! I did see those instructions and I have DevNet working with VPN turned on. Is that required? I thought we needed VPN or a whitelisted validator node, not both.

elements.text:
Hi Curtis,
Thanks for your message! I did see those instructions and I have DevNet working with VPN turned on. Is that required? I thought we needed VPN or a whitelisted validator node, not both.

text: Regarding your other points, we do clean-all, we have the correct. migration id (2); i installed the june version of daml but qs actually requires the older version.

text: Is there any way to multiplex GRPC (and HTTP) through one port? I can almost get nginx to do it, but I can't get a client to work on the resulting system.

elements.text: Is there any way to multiplex GRPC (and HTTP) through one port? I can almost get nginx to do it, but I can't get a client to work on the resulting system.
I had this in nginx:

location / {
      grpc_pass
until today we discovered that the admin API isn't HTTP

text:
And when we first tried, ex.
```grpcurl mynode:443/somepath list```
didn't work

elements.text: And when we first tried, ex.
grpcurl mynode:443/somepath list
didn't work
which makes the otherwise-obvious

location / {
      grpc_pass
not work

text: Interesting; that is essentially what I tried initially

elements.text: Interesting; that is essentially what I tried initially

text: And to be fair, nginx seemed fine with that, it was only when I tried to hit it with grpc that I couldn't get it to work

text: Hmmm the idea is mostly to have access to the admin api and the main ledger api through the same port. We need access to the admin so we can upload DARs and change topology (were doing external signing). I'd think most services would not conflict?
